intro: Reinwardtia tetragyna, commonly known as the four-angled reinwardtia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive four-angled stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus Reinwardtia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species for horticultural and ecological studies.
